east by marco polo and serve considerably to confirm the authenticity of rabbi banjamin who as a jew feel more interest in attend to he countryman -- e section xi _ account of the imperial city of cambalu and the court of the great khan or emperor of the tartar _ during the three winter month of December January and February kublai-khan generally reside in cambalu -lrb- 1 -rrb- which be at the north-east border of kathay on the north part of the new city stand the great palace of the khan in the first place be a great wall surround a vast square enclosure each side be eight mile in length the wall be environ on the outside by a deep ditch and have a great gate in the middle of each side within this outer wall there be another exactly a mile distant each side of the square which it form be six mile and in the space between these two wall the soldier attend and perform they exercise and evolution this inner square have three gate on its south side and the same number on the north the middle gate of both these side be greater and more magnificent than the other and be appropriate to the sole use of the khan the other be open to all who have a right to pass in each corner of this second wall and in the middle of each side there be very large and magnificent building eight in all which be appropriate as storehouse or arsenal for keep the warlike weapon and furniture belong to the khan : as horse trappings of all kind in one bow and arrow and cross-bow in a second helmet cuirass and leather armor in a third and so on in the rest within this second circuit and at a considerable distance there be a third wall likewise square each side be a mile in length this wall be ten pace high and very thick with white battlements have six gate as in the second wall between this third wall and the former there be a extensive park with many fine tree and large meadow well stock with deer and other game and the road be raise two cubit above the meadow to save the grass from be trodden all of this park be keep in the finest order imaginable in the four angle and in the middle of each side of this interior wall there be eight large and magnificent building in which the khan provision and other thing belong to the court be store up within this last wall be the palace of the great khan which be the largest and most magnificent of any in the world -lrb- 2 -rrb- extend the whole way between the north and south wall of the inner circuit except a opening of sufficient width for the passage of the soldier and baron attend the court the palace have no ceiling -lrb- 3 -rrb- but the roof be very high the foundation of the pavement or floor be raise ten palm above the ground and be surround by a marble wall of two pace wide resemble a walk and at the end of the wall without there be a fair turret ornament with pillar in the wall of the hall and chamber there be numerous figure of dragon soldier bird and beast of various kind and representation of battle all finely carve and splendidly gilded and the roof be so richly ornamented that nothing be to be see but splendid gold and imagery in every square of the palace there be a great hall capable of contain a prodigious multitude of people and all the chamber be arrange and dispose in the best possible manner the roof be all richly paint red green azure and all other color behind the palace there be many great room and private storehouse for the treasure and jewel of the khan for the dwelling of he woman and for various other private purpose over against the palace of the khan there be another which be formerly inhabit by he deceased son zingi who hold a court in all thing resemble that of he father near the palace and to the north there be a high artificial mount a mile in circumference and a hundred pace high plant with evergreen tree which be bring from remote place with all they root on the back of elephant : this eminence be call the _ green mountain _ and be extremely pleasant and beautiful where the earth be take away to form this mount there be two lake correspond with each other supply by a small river and well store with fish and the passage of the water be grate in such a manner that the fish can not escape the city of cambalu be seat on a great river in the province of kathay or northern china and its name signify the city of the prince have be the royal residence in former time after the conquest understanding from he astrologer that the inhabitant would rebel the great khan remove the city to the other side of the river call the new city taidu which be twenty-four mile in circumference every side of the square be six mile and he command all the kathayan to remove from the old city into the new one the wall be of earth ten pace thick at the bottom and gradually taper to three pace thick at the top with white battlements each side of the square have three principal gate or twelve in all have sumptuous palace build over each and there be pavilion in all the angle of the wall where the arm of the garrison be keep be 1000 man for each gate the whole building of this city be exactly square and all the street be lay out in straight line so that a free prospect be preserve from gate to gate through the whole city and the house be build on each side like palace with court and garden divide accord to the head of family in the middle of the whole there be a noble building in which a great bell be suspend after the toll of which at a certain hour of the night no person must go out of he house till the dawn of next morning except it be for some urgent cause as for assistance to a woman in labor and even then they must carry light on the outside of the wall there be twelve large suburb extend three or four mile in length from each gate and there be more inhabitant in these suburb than within the wall in these foreign merchant and other stranger live each nation have several storehouse and bazar in which they lodge and keep they goods no dead body be allow to be burnt or bury within the city but the body of the idolater be burn without the suburb and the body of all other sect be bury in the same place on account of the vast multitude of mahometan who inhabit here there be above 25000 harlot in the city and suburb : over every 100 and every 1000 of these there be chief or captain appoint to keep they in order and one general inspector over the whole when any ambassador or other person have business with the khan come to cambalu he whole charge be defray from the imperial treasury and the general inspector of the harlot provide the ambassador and every man of he family a change of woman every night at free cost the guard of the city carry all whom they may find walk in the street after the appoint hour to prison and it these person can not give a valid excuse they be beat with cudgel as the bachsus allege that it be not right to shed men blood yet many person die of this beating there be 12000 horse-guard call casitan who attend on the person of the khan more from state than from any suspicion of danger these have four chief commander one to every 3000 man and one commander with he band of 3000 keep guard over the khan for three day and night after which he be succeed by another and so on in regular order when the khan hold a solemn court on any particular day of festival he table be raise higher than all the rest and be set on the north side of the hall have he face to the south he first queen or principal wife be place on he left hand and he son and nephew and other prince of the blood-royal be arrange on he right but they table be place so much lower that they head be hardly so high as the khan foot the prince and other lord of the court sit lower still on the right hand and the lady be all place in similar order on the leave those of the son and kinsman of the khan be next to the queen and after these the wife of the lord and officer each accord to they several rank in due order by this mean the khan as he sit at table can see all that feast along with he in the hall there be not table for all who be admit to the feast but the greatest part of the soldier and captain sit down on carpet where they be serve with victuals and drink at all the door there be two gigantic fellow with cudgel who observe carefully if any one touch the threshold in go in and whoever do so forfeit he garment or receive a certain number of blow of a cudgel those who serve the khan or who sit at he table have they mouth cover with silken veil lest they breath should touch the meat or drink which he be to use when he drink the damsel who carry the cup kneel down and then all the baron and other present kneel likewise and all the musician sound they instrument till the khan have do drinking if i be to describe all the pomp and magnificence of these festival and all die dainty and delicate dish which be serve up i should become prolix and tiresome the birth day of they lord be celebrate with great reverence among the tartar that of kublai-khan they great emperor be hold yearly on the twenty-eighth day of September and be keep with greater solemnity than any other festival except that of the new year which be celebrate on the first day of February when the tartar year commence on he birth day the great khan be clothe in a most splendid robe of cloth of gold and about 2000 of he baron and soldier receive on this occasion silken garment of a golden color and girdle work in gold or silver with each a pair of shoe some of those who be next to the khan in dignity wear pearl and jewel of great value these splendid garment be only wear on thirteen solemn festival correspond to the thirteen moon or lunar month into which the tartar year be divide when all the great man of the court be splendidly habit like so many king the birth-day of the great khan be celebrate by all the tartar throughout he extensive dominion and on this day all the king prince governor and noble who be subject to he authority send present to he in honor of the day and in token of submission such as be desirous of obtain any place of dignity or office present they petition to a council of twelve baron appoint for that express purpose and they decision be consider as equivalent to a answer from the khan in person all the people of the immense dominion who acknowledge the authority of the great khan whether christian or jew mahometan tartar or pagan be bind on this anniversary to pray solemnly to they god for the life safety prosperity and health of the great khan on the first of February which be the commencement of the tartar year the great khan and all the tartar wherever they may happen to be at the time observe a very solemn feast and all of they both man and woman be desirous on that occasion to be clothe in white garment that fortune may be favourable to they for the remainder of the year on this occasion the governor of province and ruler of city and all who be in office or authority send present to the khan of gold silver pearl and precious stone likewise of many white cloth of various kind and other white thing and many white horse it be the custom of those who bring present if they can to present nine time nine of every particular article whether it be gold or silver or cloth or horse and on this occasion the khan sometimes receive 100000 horse on this grand festival all the elephant belong to the great khan about 5000 be bring into the great court of the palace cover with splendid housing of tapestry work with the figure of various kind of bird and beast each of they bear on they back two chest fill with vessel of gold and silver and many camel be parade on the same occasion cover over with fine silken cloth and load with other necessaries for the court on the morning of this festival of the new year all the captain baron soldier -lrb- 4 -rrb- physician astrologer governor of province general of army and other officer of the great khan assemble before the emperor in the great hall of the palace all place in due order accord to they rank and dignity and those who have no place or employment stand without that they may see the ceremony one of the head of they priest then rise and cry out with a loud voice bow down and adore on which all who be present bend down they forehead to the earth he then call out aloud god preserve we khan and grant he long life and happiness and all the people answer god grant this then he say may god increase and advance he empire and preserve all he subject in peace concord and prosperity and the people say god grant this we prayer all this be repeat four time then the chief priest go forwards to a red table or altar richly adorn on which the name of the khan be write and take a censer contain rich spice and perfume he perfume the altar or table with great reverence in honor of the khan and return to he place in the assembly after the conclusion of this ceremony the various gift which have be already mention be present to the khan and then the table be prepared and a most solemn and splendid dinner be serve up of which all the assistant with they wife partake eat and drink with great joy as formerly describe in the course of this solemn feast a tame lion be lead up to the khan which lie down at he foot as gentle as a whelp acknowledge and caress he lord in those three winter month during which the khan reside in cambalu viz December January and February all the imperial huntsman who be maintain in the province contiguous to kathay employ themselves continually in hunting and bring all the larger wild beast such as stag deer roe-buck bear and wild-boar to they governor or master of the game and if within thirty day journey of cambalu all these be send in waggon to the court be first embowelled but such as be at a greater distance send only the skin which be use in make housing and other military article the khan have many leopard wolf and even lion train for hunting these lion be larger than those which be find near babylon and be variegate with small spot of white black and red they be breed to catch bear boar stag roe-buck wild ass and wild bull and it be wonderful to see they dexterity and fierceness in the chase when these lion be take out to hunt they be carry in waggon two together accompany by a dog with which they be familiar they be manage in this manner because of they fierce and unruly disposition and they must be draw towards the game against the wind otherwise the beast would scent they and fly away there be also many tame eagle so train as to take hare roe-buck deer and fox and some of these will even seize upon wolf and vex they so grievously that the man may take they without danger for the conduct of the imperial hunt there be two great officer call ciurco or master of the game who be brother name boyan and mingan each of whom have the command of 10000 man those who belong to one of these division be clothe in red and the other in sky blue and they keep various kind of dog such as mastiff and other for hunting to the number of 5000 or more when the khan go to hunt one of these great company of hunter stretch out on he right hand and the other on he left occupy the plain country to the breadth of a whole day journey so that no beast can escape they and when they have collect the game into a circle it be delightful to see the khan go into the middle with number of dog which hunt down the hart and bear and other wild beast the master of the game be bind by they commission to send to court between the beginning of October and end of march 1000 head of beast besides bird of various kind and fish the best they can procure -lrb- 1 -rrb- the proper name of this place be kan-balgassan or for shortness khan-balga signify the city of the khan arabian author have change it to khan-balick or khan-baligh and the italian to chanbalig chanbalu cambalu and even gamelecco the chinese call this northern part of the imperial city king-tshing which have the same meaning with the tartar name and may be translate kingstown pe-king the other part of the same city signify the northern court or residence -- forst -lrb- 2 -rrb- the description of this palace be exceedingly confused and unintelligible most probably from erroneous transcription and mistake in translation -- e -lrb- 3 -rrb- by this obscure expression it seem to be imply that there be no upper room -- e -lrb- 4 -rrb- the soldier mention here and in other place as present in the great hall upon solemn occasion can only mean the officer of the military actually on guard over the person of the khan at the time -- e section xii _ of the magnificence of the court of the great khan and of the manners and custom of he subject _ in the beginning of march the great khan depart from cambalu and proceed north towards the ocean -lrb- 1 -rrb- which be at the distance of two day journey accompany by 10000 falconer with falcon ger-falcon hawk and other bird of prey that be train to the sport these falconer disperse themselves in company of 100 or 200 together and most of the bird that be take be bring to the khan who on account of the gout which have disabled he from ride sit in a wooden house cover with lion skin and hang within with cloth of gold which be carry on the back of two elephant for he particular recreation he be accompany by twelve choice hawk carry by twelve noble many other nobleman and soldier attend he when any crane or pheasant or other bird be see notice be give to the falconer who be near the khan and by these to the khan himself who then order he travel house to be remove and the hawk to be fly at the game and he sit in he bed enjoy the sport ten thousand man attend the khan who disperse two and two together to mark where the falcon fly that they may assist they when needful and bring back they and they game to the khan these man be call _ tascoal _ which signify watchman or marksman and have a peculiar whistle by which they call in the hawk and falcon so that it be not necessary that the falconer who let fly the hawk should follow they as these tascoal be busily employ in take up the hawk and be very careful that none of they be hurt or lose every hawk have a small plate of silver attach to the foot on which be the peculiar mark of its master that each may be restore to its right owner but if the mark be lose or can not be know the hawk be deliver to a certain baron whose name of office be bulangazus to whom all lose thing whatever must be bring otherwise the finder would be punish as a thief and to the bulangazus all who have lose any thing make application this man be distinguish by a peculiarly conspicuous ensign that he may be easily find out in so numerous a assemblage while thus busily employ in hawk the royal retinue come at length to a great plain call carzarmodin where the tent of the khan and all the courtier be pitch to the number of 10000 or more the grand pavilion of the khan be so large that 10000 man might stand within it besides baron and nobleman it be place with its entrance to the south support upon curiously carve pillar and be cover on the outside with the skin of lion and other wild beast to keep out the rain but the whole inside be line with sable and ermine to a immense value for so precious be these skin esteem that a sufficient number to make one garment only will sometimes cost 2000 gold sultany and the tartar call the sable the queen of fur all the cord of the imperial pavilion be of silk around this there be other pavilion for the son wife and concubine of the khan at a farther distance there be tent for the falcon ger-falcon hawk and other bird of game and the whole encampment seem at a distance like a great city or the station of a large army the khan remain all the month of march in that plain employ in hawk and the multitude of beast and fowl which be take in that time be quite incredible from the beginning of march to the month of October no person be permit to hunt within five day journey of this plain of carzarmodin in one direction ten in another and fifteen in a third nor to keep any hawk or hunting dog neither to use any device or engine whatever for take any stag deer roe-buck hare or other game lest the breed should be injure by which mean the game be always in great abundance it be quite wonderful to behold what number of merchant and other people and what astonishing quantity of merchandize and goods of all sort be to be see in cambalu the money of the great khan be not of gold or silver or other metal but of a species of paper which be thus make : they take the middle dark of the mulberry tree which they make firm in a particular manner and this be cut out into round piece of various size on which the seal or mark of the khan be impressed of this paper money a immense quantity be fabricate in the city of cambalu sufficient to supply the currency of the whole empire and no person under pain of death may coin or spend any other money or refuse to accept of this in all the kingdom and country which be subject to he dominion all who come into he dominion be prohibit from use any other money so that all merchant come from country however remote must bring with they gold silver pearl or precious stone for which they receive the khan paper money in exchange : and as that money be not receive in other country they must exchange it again in the empire of the great khan for merchandize to carry with they on they return the khan pay all salary stipend and wages to he officer servant and army in this money and whatever be require for the service of he court and household be pay for in the same by all these means there be no sovereign in the world who equal the great khan in extent of treasure as he expend none in the mint or in any other way whatever the great khan have a council of war compose of twelve baron as formerly mention who direct all martial affair and have the power of promote or disgrace officer and soldier as they think proper they office be call _ thai _ or the high court or tribunal as no person in the empire be superior to they except the great khan other twelve baron be appoint as counsellor for the thirty-four province into which the vast empire of the khan be divide these have a splendid palace in cambalu as they office in which there be a judge for each province and many notary this tribunal choose proper person to be appoint governor of the province and present they name to the khan for confirmation they likewise have the charge of the collection and expenditure of the public treasure the name of they office be _ singh _ or the second court which be subordinate only to the khan yet be consider as less noble than the _ thai _ or military tribunal many public road lead from cambalu to all the neighbouring province and on every one of these there be inn or lodgings call _ lamb _ build at the distance of every twenty-five or thirty mile which serve as post - house have large fair court and many chamber furnish with bed and provision every way fit to lodge and entertain great man and even king the provision be furnish from the circumjacent country out of the tribute at every one of these there be four hundred horse two hundred of which be keep ready for use in the stable and the other two hundred at grass each division for a month alternately these horse be destine for the use of ambassador and messenger who leave they tired horse and get fresh one at every stage in mountainous place where there be no village the khan have establish colony of about ten thousand people in each in the neighborhood of these post-house that they may cultivate the ground and supply provision these excellent regulation extend to the utmost limit of the empire in all direction so that there be about ten thousand imperial inn or lamb in the whole empire and the number of horse appoint in these for the service of messenger exceed two hundred thousand -lrb- 2 -rrb- by which mean intelligence be forward to the court without delay from all part of the empire if any person should wonder how so many beast and man can be procure and provide for let he consider that the mahometan and pagan have many woman and great number of child some have even so many as thirty son all able to follow they arm into the field as for victuals they sow rice panik and millet which yield a hundred after one and they allow no land that be fit to carry crop to remain uncultivated as wheat do not thrive in this country it be little sown and they use no bread but feed upon the formerly mention grain boil in milk or make into broth along with flesh they horse continually increase insomuch that every tartar soldier carry six eight or more horse into the field for he own use which he ride upon in they turn all city that be adjoining to river or lake be order to have ferry-boat in constant readiness for the post and those which be on the border of desert must supply horse and provision for such as have to pass through these desert for which service they be allow a reasonable compensation from the state in case of great conscience the messenger have a gerfalcon badge formerly mention and be so equip that he will ride 200 or 250 mile in a day and night be attend in dark night by person who run along with he on foot carry light on approach a post-house the messenger sound a horn that a fresh horse or horse accord to he company may be bring out and ready to mount immediately these speedy messenger have then belly loin and head firmly swathe and they always travel as fast as they horse can go and such as be able to endure this excessive ride be hold in great estimation as nothing be more admire among the tartar than good horsemanship between the _ lamb _ or large post-house there be other habitation at three or four mile distance from each other where foot-post be establish every one of whom have he girdle hang round with shrill sound bell these be always in readiness and when dispatch with the khan letter they convey they with great speed to the next foot-post station where they hear the sound of the bell from a distance and some one be always in readiness to take the letter and to run on to the next station : thus by constant change of swift runner the letter be convey with great dispatch to they destination by this mean the khan often receive letter or new fruit in two day from the distance often ordinary day journey : as for instance fruit grow at cambalu in the morning be convey to xandu by the night of the next day all the people employ in the post besides be exempt from all tribute have a ample recompense for they labor from the gatherer of the khan rent there be inspector employ who examine the state and conduct of these post every month and be empower to punish those who be guilty of fault the khan send every year to the different province of he empire to inquire whether any injury have be sustain to the crop by tempest locust worm or any other calamity and when any province or district have suffer damage the tribute be remit for that year and he even send corn for food and seed from the public granary : for in year of great abundance he purchase large quantity of grain which be carefully preserve for three or four year by officer appoint for the purpose by which mean when a scarcity occur in any province the defect may be supply from the granary of the khan in another province on these occasion he order he grain to be sell at a fourth part of the market price and great care be take to keep he granary always well supply when any murrain attack the cattle of one of the province the deficiency be supply from the tenth which he receive in the other province if any beast or sheep happen to be kill by lightning in a flock or herd he draw no tribute from that flock however great for three year under a idea that god be angry with the owner of the herd that traveller may discern and be able to discover the road in uninhabited place tree be plant at convenient distance along all the principal road and in the sandy and desert place where tree will not grow stone and pillar be erect to direct the passenger and officer be appoint to see that all these thing be perform accord to the opinion of the astrologer the planting of tree conduce to lengthen the age of man and therefore the khan be the more induce to encourage they propagation by he order and example in the province of cathay the people make excellent drink of rice and certain spice which even excel wine in flavor and those who drink too much of it become sooner drunk than with wine -lrb- 3 -rrb- through this whole province certain black stone be dig from the mountain which burn like wood and preserve fire a long time and if kindle in the evening will keep on fire all night -lrb- 4 -rrb- and many people use these stone in preference to wood because though the country abound in tree there be a great demand for wood for other purpose the great khan be particularly attentive to the care of the poor in the city of cambalu when he hear of any honorable family that have fall to decay through misfortune or of any who can not work and have no subsistence he give order for issue a whole year subsistence together with garment both for winter and summer to the head of those distressed family there be a appropriate office or tribunal for this imperial bounty to which those who have receive the warrant or order of the khan apply for relief the khan receive the tenth of all wool silk and hemp which he cause to be manufacture into stuff of all kind in house set apart for this purpose and as all artificer of every description be bind to work for he one day in every week he have immense quantity of every kind of useful commodity in he storehouse by these means likewise there be similar imperial manufacture in every city of the empire in which clothing be make from he tithe wool for he innumerable soldier accord to they ancient custom the tartar give no alms and be in use to upbraid those who be in poverty as hate of god but the priest of the idolater especially those who have be formerly mention under the name of bachsus have convince the khan that charity be a good work and a acceptable service to god so that in he court food and raiment be never deny to those who ask and there be no day in which there be less than the value of 20000 crown distribute in act of charily particularly in rice millet and panik by which extensive benevolence the khan be esteem as a god among he subject there be in cambalu about five thousand astrologer and diviner christian mahometan and kathayan all of whom be provide yearly by the khan in food and raiment these have a astrolabe on which all the sign of the planet be mark together with the hour and most minute subdivision of the whole year by this instrument these astrologer each religion apart observe the course of the year accord to every moon note the prognostication of the weather yet always refer to god to do as they predict or otherwise accord to he pleasure they write down upon square tablet call _ tacuinus _ all those thing which be to fall out during the year which they sell to any who will purchase and those who be most fortunate in they prediction be hold in the highest honor if any one intend to commence a important labor or to undertake a distant journey and be anxious to be certify of the event he have recourse to the astrologer to read as they pretend he destiny in the heaven for this purpose be instruct in the precise date of birth of the person consult they they calculate the present aspect of the constellation which rule at he birth and foretel that good or evil will flow from he intention the tartar compute time by cycle of twelve lunar year call the first of each series the year of the lion the second of the ox the third of the dragon the fourth of the dog and so on through the whole twelve and when these be go through they begin the series anew thus if a man be ask when he be bear he answer that it be on such a division of such a hour day and moon in the year of the lion ox or so forth all this they father set down exactly in a book it have be already say that the tartar be idolater each man of any consequence have a table aloft in the wall of one of he chamber on which a name be write to signify the great god of heaven whom he adore once each day with a censer of burn incense and lift up he hand and thrice gnash he tooth he pray to god to grant he health and understanding this be the only petition address to the almighty of whom they pretend not to make any similitude but they have a statue or image on the ground call _ natigaus _ the god of earthly thing and image of he wife and child this be likewise worship with incense gnashing of tooth and lift up the hand and from this they beg for favourable weather productive crop increase of child and all manner of worldly prosperity they believe the soul to be immortal and that when a man die he soul enter into another body better or worse accord to the merit or demerit of he former life : as that a poor man become a gentleman then a prince or lord and so higher till at length the soul be absorb in god or if he have deserve ill it descend to animate the body of a lower and poorer man after that the body of a dog always descend to the lowest rank of baseness in they manners the language of the tartar be comely they salute one another with grace and cheerfulness conduct themselves honestly and they feed in a cleanly manner they bear great reverence to they parent and if any one be undutiful or regardless of they necessity they be liable to the jurisdiction of a public tribunal especially assign for the punishment of ungrateful or disobedient child person condemn to imprisonment for crime be discharge after three year confinement when they be mark on the cheek that they may be know as malefactor all baron or other who approach within half a mile of the residence of the great khan must be still and quiet no noise or loud speech be permit in he presence or neighborhood every one who enter the hall of presence must pull off he boot lest he soil the carpet and put on furred buskin of white leather give he other boot to the charge of servant till he quit the hall and every one carry a small covered vessel to spit in as no one dare spit in the hall of the palace -lrb- 1 -rrb- the desert or tartarian waste be probably mean in subject to the great khan -lrb- 1 -rrb- _ ten mile from cambalu be a great river call pulisangan -lrb- 2 -rrb- which empty itself into the ocean and by which many vessel ascend with merchandize to a certain handsome bridge all build of serpentine stone curiously work this bridge be 300 pace in length and eight pace broad so that ten man may ride abreast it be secure on each side with a wall of marble ornament with a row of pillar the pillar on each side at the summit of the bridge have the image of a great lion on the top and another at its base and all the other which be at interval of a pace and a half have figure of lion on they top only after pass this bridge and proceed to the westward for thirty mile continually pass through vineyard and fertile field with numerous palace on all side you come to the fair and large city of gouza in which there be many idol temple and in which cloth of gold and silk and the purest and finest cambric or lawn be manufacture it contain many common inn for stranger and traveller and the inhabitant be very industrious in trade and manufacture a mile beyond this city the road divide into two that to the west lead through the province of kathay and that to the south-east towards the province of mangus from gouza to the kingdom of tain-fu -lrb- 3 -rrb- in this journey you ride for ten day through kathay always find many fair and populous city well cultivate field and numerous vineyard from whence all kathay be supply with wine and many plantation of mulberry tree for rear silk worm tain-fu be the name of the kingdom or province and of the chief city which be large and handsomely build carry on much trade and contain great magazine of military store for the khan army seven day journey farther to the west there be a pleasant country have many city and castle and carry on great trade we then come to a very large city call pian-fu in which there be vast abundance of silk and much trade westwards from pian-fu there be a pleasantly situated castle call thaigin contain a spacious palace with a fine hall in which there be portrait of all the famous king who have reign in this country this castle and palace be say to have be build by a king name dor who be very powerful and be only attend on by great number of young damsel who use to carry he about the castle in a small light chariot confide in the strength of this castle which he believe impregnable dor rebel against umcan to whom he be tributary but seven of he courtier or attendant in whom he place confidence make he prisoner one day while hunting and deliver he to umcan who dress he in mean clothes and set he under a strong guard to tend he cattle at the end of two year umcan call dor into he presence and after a severe reproof and admonition for he future obedience dress he in princely robe and send he back to he kingdom with a powerful escort about twenty mile beyond the castle of thaigin we come to the great river caramaran -lrb- 4 -rrb- which be so broad and deep that it have no bridge between this place and the ocean there be many city town and castle on the bank of this river which carry on great trade the country abound in ginger and silk and fowl of all kind particularly pheasant be so plentiful that three of they may be purchase for a venetian groat along the bank of this river there grow vast quantity of great reed or hollow cane -lrb- 5 -rrb- some of which be a foot or eighteen inch round and be apply to many useful purpose two day journey beyond this river be the famous city of carianfu in which great quantity of silk and cloth of gold be make this country produce ginger galuigal spike and many spice and the inhabitant be idolater proceed seven day journey westwards we pass through many city and town and fine field and garden and everywhere there be plantation of mulberry for feed silk-worm and abundance of wild beast and fowl the inhabitant be mostly idolater with some christian or nestorian and saracen or mahometan continue the journey for seven day we come to a great city call quenzanfu which be the capital of the kingdom of that name in which many famous king have reign at the present time mangalu one of the son of the great khan have the supreme command of this kingdom this country yield great plenty of silk and cloth of gold and all thing necessary for the subsistence of a army and the maintenance of its numerous inhabitant the people be mostly idolater but there be some christian and mahometan among they five mile from the city stand the palace of mangalu in a fine plain water by numerous spring and rivulet and abound in game this fine palace all paint with gold and azure and adorn with numberless statue stand in the middle of a fine park of five mile square surround by a high wall in which all kind of beast and fowl be to be find in abundance and in this place mangalu and he courtier take great delight to hunt he follow he father excellent example in conduct he government with great equity and justice and be much beloved and respect by the people proceed three day to the westward from the palace of mangalu through a very beautiful plain adorn with many city and castle which have great abundance of silk and other manufacture we come to a mountainous district of the province of chunchian in the vally of which there be many village and hamlet the inhabitant be idolater and husbandman in these mountain they hunt lion bear stags roebuck deer and wolf the plain be two day over and for twenty day journey to the west the country be well inhabit and finely diversify with mountain vally and wood at the end of these twenty day there lie towards the west a populous province call achbaluch mangus or the _ white _ city on the border of mangus on enter this province we find a plain of two day journey in extent and contain a prodigious number of village beyond which the country be diversify with mountain vally and wood yet all well inhabit in these mountain there be plenty of wild beast among which be the animal that produce musk this province produce rice and other grain and abundance of ginger after twenty day journey through these hill we come to a plain and a province on the confines of mangus call sindinfu the city of the same name be very large and exceedingly rich be twenty mile in circumference of old this city and province be govern by a race of rich and powerful king on the death of a old king he leave the succession among three son who divide the city into three part each surround by its own wall yet all contain within the former wall of the city but the great khan subject the city and province to he dominion through this city and its environs there run many river some half a mile over and some a hundred pace all very deep and on these there be many handsome stone bridge eight pace broad have marble pillar on each side support wooden roof and on every bridge there be house and shop after pass this city all these river unite into one great river call the quian or kian which run from hence one hundred day journey before it reach the ocean have many city and castle on its bank with innumerable trading vessel proceed four day journey farther we pass through a fine plain contain many city castle and village and several beautiful green lawn or pasture in which there be many wild beast beyond this last mention plain be the wide country of thebet or thibet which the great khan vanquish and lay waste and in it there be many ruin city and castle for the space of twenty day journey which have become a uninhabited wilderness full of lion and other wild beast those who have to travel through this country must carry victuals along with they and must use precaution to defend themselves against the ferocious animal of the desert very large cane grow all over this country some of which be ten pace long and three palm thick and as much between the knot or joint when traveller take up they quarter for the night they take large bundle of the greener reed or cane which they put upon the top of a large fire and they make such a crackling noise in burning as to be hear for two mile off by which the wild beast be terrify and fly from the place but it have sometimes happen that the horse and other beast belong to the merchant or traveller have be frighten by this noise and have run away from they master : for which reason prudent traveller use the precaution of fetter or bind they foot together to prevent they from run off -lrb- 1 -rrb- owe to the prodigious revolution which have take place in the east since the time of marco _ at the end of twenty day journey through the before mention depopulated country we meet with city and many village inhabit by a idolatrous people whose manners be so licentious that no man marry a wife who be a virgin hence when traveller and stranger from other country come among they the woman of the country who have marriageable daughter bring they to the tent of the stranger and entreat they to enjoy the company of they daughter so long as they remain in the neighborhood on these occasion the handsomest be choose and those who be reject return home sorrowful and disappointed the stranger be not permit to carry away any of these willing damsel but must restore they faithfully to they parent and at parting the girl require some toy or small present which she may shew as a token of she condition and she who can produce the greatest number of such favor have the greatest chance of be soon and honourably marry when a young woman dress herself out to the best advantage she hang all the favor she may have receive from she different lover about she neck and the more acceptable she may have be to many such transitory lover so much the more be she honor among she countryman but after marriage they be never suffer to have intercourse with stranger and the man of the country be very cautious of give offence to each other in this matter the people of this country be idolater who live by hunting yet cultivate the ground and be much addict to steal which they account no crime they be clothe in the skin of wild beast or in coarse hempen garment have no money not even the paper money of the khan but they use piece of coral instead of money they language be peculiar to themselves the country of which we now speak belong to thibet which be a country of vast extent and have be some time divide into eight kingdom in which be many city and town with many mountain lake and river in some of which gold be find the woman wear coral necklace which they likewise hang about the neck of they idol in this country there be very large dog almost as big as ass which be employ in hunting the wild beast especially wild ox call boyaminus in this province of thibet there be many kind of spice which be never bring into europe this like all the other province formerly mention be subject to the great khan on the west of the province of thibet lie the province of caindu which be formerly govern by king of its own but be now rule by governor appoint by the great khan by the west it be not to be understand that these country be actually in the west but that as we travel to they from those part which be situate between the east and the north-east and consequently come thither westwards we therefore reckon they as be in the west -lrb- 1 -rrb- the people be idolater and have many city of which the principal be call caindu after the name of the province and be build on the frontier in this country there be a large salt lake which produce such extraordinary abundance of white pearl but not round that no person be allow to fish for they under pain of death without a licence from the great khan lest by become too plentiful the price should be too much reduce there be likewise a mountain produce turquoise the digging for which be restrain under similar regulation there be great number of the animal call _ gadderus _ in this province which produce musk the lake which produce pearl be likewise very abundant in fish and the whole country be full of wild beast of many kind as lion bear stag deer ounce and roebuck and many kind of bird clove also be find in great plenty which be gather from small tree resemble the bay-tree in bough and leave but somewhat longer and straighter have white flower the clove when ripe be black or dusky and very brittle the country likewise produce ginger and cinnamon in great plenty and several other spice which be not bring to europe it have no wine but in place of it the inhabitant make a most excellent drink of corn or rice flavor with various spice the inhabitant of this country be so besotted to they idol that they fancy they secure they favor by prostitute they wife sister and daughter to stranger when any stranger come among they all the master of family strive to procure he as a guest after which they leave the stranger to be entertain by the female of the family and will not return to they own house till after he departure and all this be do in honor of they idol think that they secure they favor by this strange procedure the principal money in this country be gold unstamped and issue by weight but they ordinary money consist in solid small loaf of salt mark with the seal of the prince and of this merchant make vast profit in remote place which have abundance of gold and musk which the inhabitant be eager to barter for salt to use with they meat leave this province we proceed fifteen day journey farther pass through many city and village the inhabitant of which have the same custom with those of caindu and at length we come to a river call _ brius _ which be the boundary of the province of caindu in this river gold dust be find in great abundance by wash the sand of the river in vessel to cleanse the gold from earth and sand on the bank of this river which run direct to the ocean cinnamon grow in great plenty have pass the river brius we come westwards to the province of caraian which contain seven kingdom and be under the command of sentamur as viceroy for he father the great khan this prince be young rich wise and just the country produce excellent horse be well peopled and have a peculiar and very difficult language the inhabitant be idolater who live on they cattle and the produce of the earth after proceed five day journey through this country we come to the great and famous city of jacus -lrb- 2 -rrb- in this large city there be many merchant and manufacturer and many different kind of people idolater christian nestorian and mahometan but the great majority be idolater it have abundance of corn and rice but the inhabitant only use bread make from rice as they esteem it more wholesome they make a drink also from rice mix with several kind of spice which be very pleasant they use white porcelain instead of money and certain sea shell for ornament -lrb- 3 -rrb- much salt be make in this country from the water of salt well from which the viceroy derive great profit there be a lake in this country 100 mile in circuit which have great quantity of fish the people of this country eat the raw flesh of beef mutton buffalo and poultry cut into small piece and seasoned with excellent spice but the poorer sort be contented with garlic shred down among they meat the man have no objection to permit the intercourse of stranger with they wife on condition only of be previously ask for they consent we depart from jacus or lazus and travel westwards for ten day journey we come to a province call carazan after the name of its chief city which be govern by a son of the great khan name cogatin -lrb- 4 -rrb- the river in this province yield large quantity of wash gold and likewise in the mountain solid gold be find in vein and the people exchange gold against silver at the rate of one pound of gold for six pound of silver -lrb- 5 -rrb- the ordinary currency of the country be in porcelain shell bring from indium in this country there be very large serpent some of which be ten pace long and ten span in thickness have two little foot before near the head with three talon or claw like lion and very large bright eye -lrb- 6 -rrb- they jaw have large sharp tooth and they mouth be so wide that they be able to swallow a man nor be there any man or live creature that can behold these serpent without terror some of these be only eight six or five pace in length in the day-time they lurk in hole to avoid the great heat go out only in the night in search of prey and they devour lion wolf or any other beast they can find after which they go in search of water leave such a track in the sand owe to they weight as if a piece of timber have be drag along take advantage of this circumstance the hunter fasten great iron spike under the sand in they usual track by means of which they be often wound and kill the crow or vulture proclaim the serpent fate by they cry on which the hunter come up and flea the animal take out he gall which be employ as a sovereign remedy for several disease give to the quantity of a pennyweight in wine particularly against the bite of a mad dog for woman in labor for carbuncle and other distemper they likewise get a good price for the flesh which be consider as very delicate this province breed many stout horse which be carry by the merchant into indium they commonly take out a bone from the tail of they horse to prevent they from be able to lash they from side to side as they esteem it more seemly for the tail to hang down the native who be idolater use long stirrup in ride like the french whereas the tartar and other nation use short stirrup because they rise up when they discharge they arrow in they war they use target and other defensive armor make of buffalo hide and they offensive weapon be lance and crossbow with poison arrow some of they who be great villain be say always to carry poison with they that if take prisoner they may swallow it to procure sudden death and to avoid torture on which occasion the great lord force they to swallow dog dung that they may vomit up the poison before they be conquer by the great khan when any stranger of good appearance happen to lodge with they they use to kill he in the night believe that the good property of the murder person would afterwards devolve to the inhabitant of the house and this silly notion have occasion the death of many person travel still westwards from the province of carazam or cariam we come after five day journey to the province of cardandan of which the chief city be call vociam -lrb- 7 -rrb- the inhabitant who be subject to the great khan use porcelain shell and gold by weight instead of money in that country and many other surrounding province there be no silver mine and the people give a ounce of gold for five ounce of silver by which exchange the merchant acquire great profit the man and woman cover they tooth with thin plate of gold so exactly fit that the tooth seem as if they be actually of solid gold the man make a kind of list or stripe round they leg and arm by prick the place with needle and rub in a black indelible liquid and these mark be esteem as great decoration they give themselves up entirely to ride and hunting and martial exercise leave all the household care to the woman who be assist by slave whom they purchase or take in they war immediately after delivery the woman leave she bed and wash the child after which the husband lie down in she bed with the child where he remain for forty day during all which time he receive the visit and compliment of the friend and neighbor the wife look after the house carry broth to she husband in bed and suckle the child they wine be make from rice and spicery and they ordinary food be rice and raw flesh seasoned with spicery or garlic as formerly mention there be no idol in this province except that every family adore the oldest man in the house from whom they say that they and all they have be come the country consist mostly of wild and rugged mountain into which stranger seldom come because the air especially in summer be exceedingly noxious they have no letter but all they contract and obligation be record by tally of wood one counterpart be keep by each party and when the contract be fulfil the tally be destroy there be no physician in this province or in caindu vociam or caraiam but when any one be sick the magician or priest of the idol be assemble to whom the sick person give a account of he disease then the magician dance to the sound of certain instrument and bellow forth song in honor of they idol till at length the devil enter into one of these who be skip about in the dance the dance be then discontinue and the rest of the magician consult with he who be possess as to the cause of the disease and what ought to be do for its remedy the devil answer by this person because the sick person have do this or that or have offend some particular idol then the magician entreat this idol to pardon the sick person engage if he recover that he shall offer a sacrifice of he own blood but if the devil or the priest think that the patient can not recover he say that the person have so grievously offend the idol that he can not be appease by any sacrifice if on the other hand he think the sick person may recover he order a offering of a certain number of ram with black head to be prepare by so many magician and they wife and offer up to appease the idol on this the kinsman of the sick person immediately execute the order of the devil the ram be kill and they blood sprinkle in the air the assemble magician light up great candle and perfume the whole house with the smoke of incense and aloe wood and sprinkle some of the broth make from the flesh mix with spice into the air as the portion of the idol when these thing be perform they again skip and dance in honor of the idol singing and make a horrible noise and then ask the possess priest whether the idol be now satisfy if he answer in the negative they prepare to obey any farther command but if he answer that the idol be satisfied they sit down to table and eat the flesh which be offer to the idol and drink the liquor after which the magician be pay for they trouble every one depart to he own home if the sick person recover through the providence of god he attribute the restoration of he health to the idol but if he die it be then suppose that the idol have be defraud by some of the assistant have eat of the sacrifice before all the rite be duly perform this ceremony be only practice for rich patient on whom the devil or the priest in he name impose they blind belief in 1272 the great khan send a army of 12000 veteran troops under the command of aft experienced officer name nestardin to reduce the kingdom of vociam and guarazan -lrb- 8 -rrb- as soon as the king of mien -lrb- 9 -rrb- and bengalum hear of this invasion they assemble a army of 60000 horse and foot besides a thousand elephant carry castle in each of which there be from twelve to sixteen armed man with this army the king of mien march towards the city of vociam where the tartar army be encamped nestardin regardless of the great disparity of number march with invincible courage to fight the enemy but when he draw near he encamp under cover of a great wood know that the elephant could not penetrate into the wood with the tower on they back the king of mien draw near to fight the tartar but the tartarian horse be so terrify with the sight of the elephant who be arrange along the front of the battle that it be impossible to bring they up to the charge the tartar therefore be compel to alight from they horse which they fasten to the tree and come boldly foreward on foot against the elephant among whom they discharge immense quantity of arrow so that the elephant unable to endure the smart of they wound become unmanageable and flee to the nearest wood where they break they castle and overturn the armed man with which they be fill on this the tartar remount they horse and make a furious attack on the enemy the battle continue for some time undecided and many man be slay on both side at length the army of the king of mien be defeat and put to flight leave the victory to the tartar who now hasten into the wood and make many prisoner by whose assistance they seize two hundred of the elephant which be send to the great khan before this time the tartar be unaccustomed to the use of elephant in war but the great khan have ever since have elephant in he army after this victory the great khan subject the kingdom of mien and bengalum to he empire depart from the province of carian or caraiam there be a great desert which continue for two day and a half without any inhabitant at the end of which desert there be a large plain in which great multitude meet for traffic three day in every week many people come down from the great mountain bring gold which they exchange for five time its weight of silver on which account many merchant come here from foreign country with silver and carry away gold bring likewise large quantity of merchandize to sell to these people for no stranger can go into the high mountain where the people dwell who gather gold oh account of the intricacy and impassable nature of the road after pass this plain and go to the south for fifteen day journey through uninhabited and woody place in which there be innumerable multitude of elephant rhinoceros -lrb- 10 -rrb- and other wild beast we come to mien which border upon indium at there be formerly a king in this city who be on the point of death give order to erect two pyramidal monument or tower of marble near he sepulchre one at the head and the other at the foot each of they ten fathom high and have a round ball on the top of each one of these he order to be cover with gold and the other with silver a finger breadth in thickness and round about the top of these pyramid many little bell of gold and silver be hung which give a please shrill sound when agitate by the wind the monument or sepulchre between these be likewise cover with plate of gold and silver when the great khan undertake the conquest of this country he send a valiant captain at the head of a large army mostly of cavalry of which the tartarian army principally consist after the city be win the general would not demolish this monument without order from the khan who on be inform that the former king have erect it in honor of he soul would not permit it to be injure as the tartar never violate those thing which belong to the dead in the country of mien there be many elephant and wild ox large stag and deer and various other kind of wild beast in great abundance the province of bengalum border on indium towards the south -lrb- 11 -rrb- and be subdue by the great khan while i marco polo reside in the eastern country it have its own proper king and have a peculiar language the inhabitant be all idolater and have school in which the master teach idolatry and enchantment which be universal among all the great man of the country they eat flesh rice and milk and have great abundance of cotton by the manufacture of which a great trade be carry on they abound also in spike galingal ginger sugar and various other spice and they make many eunuch whom they sell to the merchant this province continue for thirty day journey go eastward when we come to the province of cangigu -lrb- 12 -rrb- this country have its own king who be tributary to the great khan the inhabitant be idolater and have a peculiar language the king have about three hundred wife the province have much gold and many spice but these can not be easily transport as it be far distant from the sea it have also many elephant and much game the inhabitant live on flesh rice and milk have no wine but they make a excellent drink of rice and spice both man and woman ornament they face neck hand belly and leg with the figure of lion dragon and bird and these be so firmly imprint as to be almost indelible there be in this country professor of this foolish art of skin embroidery who follow no other trade but this needle work and die of fool skin and the person who have the greatest number and variety of these image be consider the finest and most gallantly ornamented amu or aniu twenty-five day journey to the east of the province of cangigu be subject to the great khan and its inhabitant be idolater who have a peculiar language this country abound in provision and have great quantity of cattle and many horse and these last be excellent be carry by the merchant for sale into indium the country be full of excellent pasture and therefore abound in buffalo and oxen both man and woman wear bracelet of gold and silver of great value on they leg and arm but those of the woman be the most valuable the province of tholoman which be likewise subject to the great khan be at the distance of eight day journey east from amu the inhabitant be idolater and use a peculiar language both man and woman be tall well shaped and of a brown complexion this country be well inhabit have many strong town and castle and the man be practice in arm and accustom to war they burn they dead after which they inclose the bone and ash in chest which they hide in hole of the mountain gold be find in great plenty yet both here and in cangigu and amu they use the cowrie shell which be bring from indium from this province of tholoman the high road lead eastward by a river on the bank of which there be many town and castle and at the end of twelve day journey we come to the great city of cintiguus the province of the same name be subject to the great khan and the inhabitant be idolater they manufacture excellent cloth from the bark of tree of which they summer clothing be make there be many lion in this country so that no person dare sleep out of door in the night and the vessel which frequent the river dare not be make fast to the bank at night from dread of the lion the inhabitant have large dog so brave and strong that they be not afraid even to attack the lion and it often happen that one man arm with a bow and arrow and assist by two of these dog will kill a lion the dog urge on by the man give the onset and the lion endeavor to take shelter beside a tree that the dog may not be able to get behind he yet he scorn to run away and hold on he stately slow space the dog always fasten on he hinder part but so cautiously and nimbly do they manage they assault that whenever the lion turn upon they they be beyond he reach then the magnanimous beast hold on he way towards a tree the man all the while ply he with arrow at every opportunity and the dog constantly tear he from behind till at length with loss of blood he fall down and die this country abound in silk which be carry by the merchant to various province by means of the river they money be paper and the inhabitant be valiant in arm at the end of ten day journey from cintiguus we come to the city of sindinfu twenty day from thence be ginguus and four day from thence towards the south be palan-fu in kathay return by the other side of the province the people be idolater and burn they dead but there be also some christian who have a church the people use paper money and be all under the dominion of the great khan they make cloth of gold and silk and very fine lawn past this city of palan-fu which have many city under its jurisdiction there run a fine river which carry great store of merchandize to cambalu by means of many canal make on purpose leave this place and travel three day journey towards the south of the province of kathay subject to the great khan be the great city of ciangu they be idolater who burn they dead and they money be the mulberry paper coin of the khan the earth in the territory of this city abound in salt which be extract in the follow manner : the earth be heap up like a hill and large quantity of water be pour on which extract the salt and run by certain conduit into cauldron in which it be boil up into fine white salt and this manufacture produce great profit to the people and the great khan as large quantity be export for sale to other country in this neighborhood there be large and fine flavored peach one of which weigh two pound under two other baron and the country again reduce to obedience seven day journey farther south be the famous city of singuimatu to which on the south a great river run which be divide by the inhabitant into two river one branch of which flow by the east towards kathay and the other by the west towards mangus -lrb- 13 -rrb- by these river or canal innumerable vessel incredible for they size and wealth carry vast quantity of merchandize through both of these province and for sixteen day journey to the south from singuimatu we meet with many city and town which carry on immense trade the inhabitant of all these country be idolater and subject to the great khan you then come to a great river call caramoran -lrb- 14 -rrb- which be say to take its rise in the dominion formerly belong to umcan or prester john in the north it be very deep and carry ship of great burden and be well stock with fish within one day journey of the sea be the two city of coigan-zu and quan-zu on opposite side of the river the one a great city and the other a small one where a fleet of 15000 vessel be keep by the great khan each fit for carry fifteen horse and twenty man these be always in readiness to carry a army to any of the island or to any remote region in case of rebellion -lrb- 15 -rrb- on pass the great river caramoran or hoang-ho we enter into the noble kingdom of mangus : but it must not be suppose that i have describe the whole province of kathay as i have not speak of the twentieth part of it for in pass through this province i have only mention the principal city on my way leave
